intro: Spironema robbinsii, commonly known as the Robbins' spirogyra, is a type of freshwater algae belonging to the genus Spironema. It is characterized by its spiral-shaped chloroplasts, which are a defining feature of the Spirogyra genus. This plant typically grows in slow-moving or still freshwater environments such as ponds and ditches. Spironema robbinsii is a filamentous alga, forming long, unbranched chains of cells. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms.
